alert.note: Alert for Caruthers - San Joaquin - Selma; Coalinga - Avenal; Los Banos - Dos Palos; Merced - Madera - Mendota; West Side Mountains South of 198; West Side Mountains north of 198; West Side of Fresno and Kings Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 14 at 1:08AM PST until February 15 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A WIND ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM PST TUESDAY MORNING UNTIL 7 PM PST TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Sustained northwest winds 15 to 25 mph, with gusts near 40 mph expected. * WHERE...The northwest portion of the San Joaquin Valley and Coastal Range. * WHEN...Valid from 7 AM PST Tuesday morning until 7 PM PST Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs may be blown down. Blowing dust could reduce visibilities in some locations. Travel will be difficult, particularly for high profile vehicles, such as campers and tractor trailers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Highways affected include, but are not limited to Interstate 5 from Kettleman City northward, Highway 99 north of Fresno County, Highway 180 west of Kerman, Highway 198 west of Hanford, and Highway 152 through Pacheco Pass.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
